content:
Great to hear that you're planning to give your trusty oxfords some TLC!

Choosing the right shoe polish or cream can make a significant difference in maintaining the appearance and longevity of your shoes. Since you didn't mention the specific material of your oxfords, I'll provide some general recommendations that should work well for most types of leather.

**For a high-gloss finish:**

* Kiwi Shoe Polish: A classic and popular choice among shoe enthusiasts, Kiwi offers a wide range of colors and finishes. Their High-Gloss polish is suitable for most leather types and provides a rich, glossy finish.
* Allen Edmonds Shoe Polish: Allen Edmonds is a well-known brand in the shoe care industry, and their polish is highly regarded for its quality and performance. They offer a range of colors and finishes, including a high-gloss option.

**For a more natural, matte finish:**

* Saphir Médaille d'Or Wax Polish: Saphir is a French brand renowned for their high-quality shoe care products. Their Médaille d'Or Wax Polish is a popular choice among shoe enthusiasts, offering a natural, matte finish that enhances the leather's natural beauty.
* Chamber's Leather Milk: Chamber's is a US-based brand that offers a range of natural, non-toxic shoe care products. Their Leather Milk is a popular choice for those who prefer a more subtle, matte finish.

**For a water-based, gentle option:**

* Lexol Leather Cleaner & Conditioner: Lexol is a well-known brand in the leather care industry, and their water-based cleaner and conditioner is a gentle, non-greasy option suitable for most leather types.
* Meltonian Shoe Cream: Meltonian is a US-based brand that offers a range of shoe care products. Their shoe cream is a water-based, gentle option that provides a soft, supple finish.

**Tips:**

* Always read the instructions and test a small, inconspicuous area of the shoe before applying any polish or cream.
* Choose a polish or cream that matches the color of your shoes as closely as possible to avoid discoloration.
* Apply a small amount of polish or cream to a soft cloth and work it into the leather in circular motions. Buff the area with a clean cloth to remove excess product and create a smooth finish.
* Regularly conditioning your shoes can help maintain their suppleness and prevent cracking.

Remember to always handle your shoes with care, and avoid using harsh chemicals or abrasive materials that can damage the leather. With the right polish or cream and proper care, your trusty oxfords will continue to look great for years to come!
